data.title: Adds flag paused to IOSGraphics to avoid exception in SwapBuffers when game is moved to background
data.body: Adds flag paused to IOSGraphics to avoid exception in SwapBuffers when game is minimized with home button or with a phone call, etc.

data.title: Bullet, Add maxSubSteps
data.body: Forgot to include this.

data.title: Trying to fix the gdx-natives.jar mistake
data.body: @aliaa detected I did a mistake by committing the gdx-natives.jar modified locally (with only the Linux natives), I have just downloaded the nightlies and extracted the gdx-natives.jar to the src to try to fix it. However, I am not sure if the nightlies contains the BufferUtils changes, by taking a look at the build date, I suppose they don't.

data.title: Added getKeyFrameIndex to Animation
fixed off-by-1 error in MD2Loader.loadFrame()
Bullet, Add SoftBody support, RayPickRagdollTest, InternalTickCallback and some minor changes
data.body:
- Allow transferring ownership for btCollisionObject, required when an object is created in C++ but the responsability for deleting is in java.
- Manage meshes in the tests so they can properly be disposed
- Add RayPickRagdollTest, simple test showing a combination of constraints.
- Include the sofbody sources.
- Add helper methods to translate vertices between softbody and mesh.
- Add SoftBodyTest.
- Add InternalTickCallback class/director and test
- Add additional functionality to btSoftBody
- Add soft mesh test.

I'm very curious about the performance of the bullet extension in general on various devices. If possible some performance feedback would be appreciated, so I can check if futher investigating optimisation is required.

data.title: GL20 Implementation using directly Monotouch OpenTK
data.body:
This pull request provides a new implementation of GL20 interface for iOS using Monotouch OpenTK directly. After some tests this change improved a lot the CPU usage for all the OpenGL calls since it avoids a lot of simulated JNI. However, it is optional to let the people test and decide what to use to avoid problems :)

There is a new configuration to decide which implementation to use, by default uses previous implementation (the JNI native one).

OpenTK-1.0.dll is now needed in the Monotouch project as a dependency.

That should enable using this new implementation.

data.title: Method in BufferUtils to get a Buffer memory address through JNI
data.body: Needed for an incoming pull request ;)

data.title: Add getTextFieldFilter() method, used for custom on screen keyboard.
Enhance WindowedMean performance
data.body: calculate mean incremental in addValue to avoid going through all values to update the mean on each getMean() after a value was added.

data.title: Added a way to generate JNI classes using jnigen using the ant script
data.body:
Just added some optional parameters to generate the JNI classes using jnigen during the ant build instead having to generate it by executing eclipse. In this way we could remove the cpp/h JNI files and the corresponding ant build files from git if we want since everyone that wants to generate the JNI to build the natives should be able through ant or through eclipse.

Hope it works and be of interest for everyone. In my case I wanted to test some JNI stuff and each time I had tons of changes in a cpp where most of them were empty lines or stuff like that.

Warning: may need some double check before merging.

data.title: Bullet, update natives (copied from nightlies)
data.body: Looks like git includes some of the natives, but isn't auto updated with the nightlies. So here they are.

data.title: FileHandle#emptyDirectory
data.body:
Small change to allow to empty but not delete a directory, optionally preserving the folder structure.
Minor change to Camera#rotateAround.

data.title: Mesh, Matrix4, Quaternion helper methods
data.body:
I use changes these for a few months now, perhaps you like them, nothing special.
- Easy way of setting a quaternion or matrix4 to the rotation between two vector3's.
- Ability to transfrom a mesh (on cpu).
- Ability to combine multiple meshes into one mesh.

data.title: Bullet, HUD and DebugDraw on tests, add Visual Studio project
data.body:
Quite some changes, most important:
- Add DebugDrawer (swipe or enter to toggle).
- Separate test files for easy reading and maintenance.
- Add hud for performance monitoring on tests.
- Add visual studio project (attach to the running project to debug)

Bounds can be recalculated from current center.

data.body:
ParticlEffect.flipY() is not implemented in the gwt backend, this commit adds it.

http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=1163

data.title: Bugfix for maxLength on TextField
data.body: For paste and setText(), things weren't taking into account characters that were accepted, and in the case of setText() it wasn't right at all :)

data.title: Bullet, add java.nio.Buffer support, add ConvexHull, modify gdxMathTypes.i
data.body:
Add java.nio.Buffer support
Add btConvexHullShape(btShapeHull)
Add ConvexHullTest
Separate gdxMathTypes.i into reusable codes
Add KinematicTest
Add vehicle model (source http://thefree3dmodels.com/stuff/vehicles/car/13-1-0-3388)
Separate the wheel from the vehicle
(I intent to use this model also in a vehicle test)

data.title: Bullet, use Matrix4, remove IndexedMesh#dispose
data.body:
- Remove downcasting of motionstate (not applicable in this form for director)
- Use Bullet.init(); in the tests instead of static loadlibrary
- Remove btIndexeMesh#dispose and delete memory in desctructor (note that this breaks code that uses the #dispose solution I used in the tests)
- Add typemapping in director methods using arguments by reference
- Use a pooled Matrix4 instead of btTransform (note that this breaks code that relies on certain methods using btTransform)
- Update the tests accordingly

data.title: Custom Onscreen keyboard must know current focused TextField.
data.body: When onscreen keyboard show it must know current focused TextField.

data.title: Added getter and setter for stepSize of Slider in Scene2d.
data.body:
Added getStepSize() and setStepSize(float stepSize) to manipulate the steps
after creation of Slider.

data.title: Bullet, Add ClosestNotMeConvexResultCallback and ClosestNotMeRayResultCallback
data.body:
Adds ClosestNotMeConvexResultCallback and ClosestNotMeRayResultCallback. Those aren't actually part of bullet, but very much used. They're based on:
http://www.continuousphysics.com/Bullet/BulletFull/classbtKinematicClosestNotMeConvexResultCallback.html
and
http://www.continuousphysics.com/Bullet/BulletFull/classbtKinematicClosestNotMeRayResultCallback.html
(both are inaccessable within swig).
I wasn't sure where to put custom c++ code so I just put them along the swig interfaces. You might want to keep an eye on the nightly build on this, because i'm not sure of that (they work for me, but i'm building on windows).

data.title: some fixes (for GL20)
data.body:
ObjLoader bugfix so textures works with GL20 too. Moved MtlLoader class outside of ObjLoader class.

why, lightmapping patch went to this by accident..
Lightmapping using second texcoord set.
